tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE attendee_preferences (
  attendee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR,
  age INT,
  gender VARCHAR,
  interests VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE events (
    event_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    event_name VARCHAR(50),
    event_type VARCHAR(50),
    event_date DATE,
    event_location VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE EventAttendees (
    attendee_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    email VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    age INT,
    preference VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE EventActivities (
    activity_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    activity_name VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    location VARCHAR,
    date DATE,
    time TIME
);

CREATE TABLE attendees (
    attendee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    full_name VARCHAR(100),
    email VARCHAR(100),
    age INT,
    gender VARCHAR(10),
    preferences JSON
)

CREATE TABLE events (
    event_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    event_name VARCHAR(100),
    date DATE,
    location VARCHAR(100),
    capacity INT
)

CREATE TABLE event_attendees (
    event_id INT,
    attendee_id INT,
    status VARCHAR(20),
    PRIMARY KEY (event_id, attendee_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (event_id) REFERENCES events(event_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (attendee_id) REFERENCES attendees(attendee_id)
)

CREATE TABLE event_activities (
    activity_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    activity_name VARCHAR(100),
    description TEXT,
    capacity INT
)

CREATE TABLE attendee_activities (
    attendee_id INT,
    activity_id INT,
    registration_date TIMESTAMP,
    PRIMARY KEY (attendee_id, activity_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (attendee_id) REFERENCES attendees(attendee_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (activity_id) REFERENCES event_activities(activity_id)
)
